page.title: 09BROADWOOD EDGE FARM
page.content:
{ Broadwood Edge Farm}covers 250 acres on the slopes of Harcles Hill about 1000 feet above sea level.The farm is owned by the National Trust as part of the Stubbins Estate,which also includes Buckden Wood.The farmhouse was built in 1772.The land is a mixture of rough moorland grazing, which is used for Gritstone sheep, and enclosed pasture,where Cheviot sheep and Friesian cattle graze.The land supports 140 cows and over 300 sheep, and the farm produces 19,600 litres of milk per week.
Mr. Wood,the tenant farmer,also manages two nearby farms at Higher and Lower Buckden,using a mixture of traditional and modern methods so that the land is preserved.
